climbs.name: The Sweet Fancy Crack
climbs.fa: Matt Scherer, Aly Bailey, Collin White. Ground up

content.description: This short, slightly overhanging crack packs a punch! begin in hand jams that slowly get smaller until your in perfect fingers then make a quick move to the jug above and clip the cord.
content.location: before the high point formation take a left uphill to a small spire the crack is on the south face

climbs.name: French Lavender
climbs.fa: Matt Scherer, Aly Bailey Ground up 7/6/2018

content.description: climb the obvious hand crack once the crack peters out trend right to a small ledge and continue up the face clipping one bolt, a fixed pin, then placing some finger sized gear in a horizontal placement. pull over the final crystals and finish on the slab to the anchor.
content.protection: double rack of hand sized pro and a couple finger sized pieces for the horizontal, 1 bolt, 1 fixed pin
content.location: this route lies on a south facing buttress uphill from dorsal.

climbs.name: Almastafa
climbs.fa: Pat Flemming, Dave Asscherick 1994 Ground Up

content.description:
Do you enjoy hand jams, finger locks, fins, and hard crystal pulling? How about all of that in one route. This route has it all and is a true classic on high quality rock that surprisingly is free of moss and liken.  

  This route climbs the left arête then transitions right under the roof to some flakes and a bolt. From there the route follows the flakes and the finger / hand crack to a bulge at the top.
content.protection: Single Rack to a bd # 3 double up maybe on the .4 - 2 bd stuff if you plan on sewing it up. There is one bolt about 1/3 of the way off you can see it from the ground.
content.location: ¼ mile up trail 14 take a left (east) up the hill and seek out the prominent spire.

content.description: This group of spires and formations is nestled between the streaked wall and the Madam Mohawk / Right of passage formations. It is mainly a collection of smaller spires.
